intro: Bomarea simplex var. acuminata, commonly known as the slender bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests.
